human: Learning to talk begins in the womb.
Babies are born with the ability to swim.
Babies have more bones than adults.
It's normal for newborns to lose weight.
There's no such thing as normal baby sleep.
Babies learn much faster than adults.
cat: The first year of a cat’s life is roughly equal to the first 15 years of human life.
Cats can rotate their ears 180 degrees.
The hearing of the average cat is at least five times stronger than that of a human adult.
In the largest domestic cat breed, the average male weighs approximately 20 pounds.
Domestic cats spend about 70 per cent of the day sleeping and 15 per cent of the day grooming.
A cat cannot see directly under its nose.
Cats have five toes on each front paw, but only four on the back ones.
Some believe that if you dream about a white cat, good luck will follow.
Meows are not innate cat language—they developed them to communicate with humans!
chicken: The chicken was the first bird to have its genome sequenced, in 2004.
Chickens can remember over 100 different faces of people or animals.
An egg develops at 88 degrees Fahrenheit, and is laid at 105 degrees.
As chickens grow older, they lay larger eggs, but fewer than when they’re younger.
Chickens can taste saltiness, but not sweetness.
A hen has to eat about four pounds of feed to make one dozen eggs.
On average, 97 chickens are killed every 0.05 seconds worldwide.
The record for most egg yolks in one egg is 9 yolks.
Chickens bodies contain 15% more water than humans.
A chicken’s heart beats from 220 to 360 times per minute.
dog: Dogs noses are wet to help absorb scent chemicals.
Three dogs survived the Titanic sinking.
A Bloodhound’s sense of smell can be used as evidence in court.
The tallest dog in the world is 44 inches tall.
A Greyhound could beat a Cheetah in a long distance race
The African Hunting dog is the most successful hunter in the world
Your dog is as smart as a two-year old
Newfoundlands make great lifeguards because they have water-resistant coats and webbed feet.
All puppies are born deaf. As they get older, they can hear 4 times better than humans can.
Dogs don’t sweat, instead they pant to cool themselves.
goat: Goats dislike water and would rather leap over streams and puddles than step in them.
Goats can be taught their name and to come when called.
A baby goat is called a kid, but did you know that a goat giving birth is said to be 'kidding'?
Kids (baby goat) use their lips to learn about the world around them
Like human kids, goat kids like to snuggle
When bottle-raised, kids will bond with their caregivers
The vocal sound a goat makes is called a bleat
Goat kids learn to stand within minutes of being born
Goats have incredible agility and balance.
rabbit: A rabbit’s best feature? Their long ears! They can turn their ears by 180 degrees. Wow.
Rabbits are amazing athletes — they can jump as high as 90 centimetres in one leap!
Rabbits have almost 360 degree vision but they are born with their eyes shut
A baby rabbit is called a kit, a female is called a doe and a male is called a buck.
Like cats, happy rabbits purr when they’re content and relaxed.
A rabbit’s teeth never stop growing! Instead, they’re gradually worn down as the rabbit chews on food
Rabbits are very social creatures that live in groups.
Some rabbits are as big as a toddler.
Rabbits groom themselves like cats do.
Some rabbits are as big as a toddler.
